Mor el pare de Carles Puigdemont
L'expresident en destaca la "bondat immensa" i la "fidelitat als valors del cristianisme de base"

06 Nov 2019, 17:57

El pare Carles Puigdemont ha mort aquest dimecres. Així ho ha explicat l'expresident de la Generalitat a Twitter. "Fa poca estona ens ha deixat el pare. La meva mare, les meves germanes i els meus germans el recordarem sempre com un home de bondat immensa i fidelitat als valors del cristianisme de base. Descansi en pau".
Puigdemont havia d'intervenir avui a través de videoconferència en un míting de JxCat a Girona, la ciutat de la qual ser alcalde abans d'accedir a la presidència del Govern. Arran de la mort del seu pare, però, ha suspès la seva participació. 
Quan Puigdemont va ser investit president per sorpresa, al ser relativament desconegut pel gran públic, va haver d'explicar llavors en diverses ocasions quins eren els seus orígens. Un record clau era el negoci familiar de la pastisseria dels seus pares a Amer, la seva localitat natal.   



El president de la Generalitat, Quim Torra, ha expressat el seu condol destacant que "la mort del pare es fa més profunda per la injustícia de l'exili i la distància forçada". "T'acompanyem en el sentiment amb l'abraçada de tot un poble que us estima", ha afegit. 



També el president del Parlament, Roger Torrent, s'ha pronunciat enviant a Puigdemont i a la seva família "una forta abraçada i tot l'escalf". L'expresident ha rebut nombroses mostres de suport, com, per exemple, la de la candidata de JxCat al 10-N, Laura Borràs, que ha expressat "la ràbia" perquè, a causa de l'exili, no hagin pogut estar junts. També l'expresidenta del Parlament Carme Forcadell, a través de Twitter, ha destacat "la injustícia enorme de patir aquests moments lluny de la família".
text:
The father of Carles Puigdemont died
The former president emphasizes "immense goodness" and "fidelity to the values of basic Christianity"

06 Nov 2019, 05:57

Father Carles Puigdemont died this Wednesday. This was explained by the former President of the Generalitat on Twitter. "The father has left us a short time ago. My mother, my sisters and my brothers will always remember him as a man of immense kindness and fidelity to the values of basic Christianity. Rest in peace."
Puigdemont was to intervene today through videoconferencing at a meeting of JxCat in Girona, the city of which he was mayor before joining the presidency of the Government. Following his father's death, however, he has suspended his participation.
When Puigdemont was invested president by surprise, since he was relatively unknown to the general public, he had to explain on several occasions what his origins were. A key record was the family business of her parents' pastry in Amer, her hometown.



The president of the Generalitat, Quim Torra, expressed his condolences, pointing out that "the father's death becomes deeper for the injustice of exile and forced distance." "We accompany you in the feeling with the embrace of a whole town that loves you", he added.



Also President of the Parliament, Roger Torrent, has spoken out sending Puigdemont and his family "a strong hug and all the warmth". The former president has received numerous samples of support, such as, for example, the candidate of JxCat at 10-N, Laura Borràs, who has expressed "rage" because, due to exile, they could not be together . Also, the former President of the Parliament, Carme Forcadell, highlighted "the enormous injustice of suffering these moments away from the family."
